content.text: Build an app called Vault of Tricks that teaches users how to perform these tricks in simple step by step instructions, it should include 5 different categories of tricks including, Card Tricks, Coin Tricks, Mind Reading, Close Up Magic, and Illusions, there should be 3 different experience levels of tricks Beginner, Intermediate, and Advanced. There should be 15 tricks in each category of tricks and these should be split evenly so that there are 5 beginner, 5 intermediate and 5 advanced tricks for all types of tricks totalling 75 tricks in total. all beginner tricks should have a green border. All intermediate tricks should have a yellow border. All Advanced tricks should have a red border. Each trick should have a progress bar that updates with each step learned after a user has clicked to confirm that they have completed the step. On the floating tab bar at the bottom should include the main tricks page, a random tricks button that has the shuffle icon, a favourites button, an account button and a settings button. The progress bar on any trick needs to live update across all pages at the same time. All tricks should have a favourite button in the shape of a heart at the top right corner each trick. Once a user has completed all steps this should trigger a completed notice that counts up in seconds, minutes, and hours, once it has reached 24 hours it should then display the date of completion this needs to live update across all pages. Under settings there should be an account settings page where a user can change their profile picture, username, real name, email address and password. When a user opens the app for the first time it should show a sign up/log in screen that cannot be closed until the user has either signed up or logged in this page will not show the floating bar tab at all. On the accounts page it should show a box at the top of the screen that has the users profile picture username and email with an edit profile button that will take them over to the account settings page. On the accounts page there should also be a progress section that will have individual boxes that will count up live, the boxes should be in progress, total steps learned, and tricks completed. Underneath the progress section on the accounts page it should have a recently completed section where it will show the most recent 5 tricks completed. On the random tricks page it must display a new tricks button so that a user can select if they want to learn a different trick than the one it has shown them, this page must also not show the user any tricks they have already completed. On the settings page there must be a switch for changing the theme between light and dark mode. On the main tricks screen there must be filter and sort box at the top of the screen that includes filtering by the type of trick, the difficulty of the trick and other filters such as shortest to longest and longest to shortest, and a to z and z to a. Each trick must Also tell a user what items they need to be able to perform the trick itself and the length of time it would take to complete.

Okay, I will create a plan to build the "Vault of Tricks" app as you described. This is a comprehensive project, and here's a breakdown of the steps we'll take:

**Features for the First Version:**

*   **Core Navigation and Structure:** Implement the floating tab bar with the main tricks page, random trick, favorites, account, and settings. The initial app opening experience will include a mandatory sign-up/login screen.
*   **Main Tricks Page:** Display the tricks categorized and filterable by type and difficulty. Each trick will show required items and estimated completion time.
*   **Trick Detail View:** A dedicated screen for each trick, displaying step-by-step instructions, a progress bar, a favorite button, and a completion tracker.

**Design Elements:**

*   **Colors:**
    *   Background: `#f0f0f0` (Light gray for a clean look)
    *   Text: `#333333` (Dark gray for readability)
    *   TextSecondary: `#666666` (Medium gray for less important text)
    *   Primary: `#007AFF` (Apple's blue for primary actions)
    *   Secondary: `#5856D6` (A vibrant purple for highlights)
    *   Accent: `#34C759` (Green for positive feedback)
    *   Card: `#FFFFFF` (White for card backgrounds)
    *   Highlight: `#FF9500` (Orange for important elements)
*   **Typography:** Use a modern, clean font like "System" (default for iOS and Android) or consider loading "Roboto" for a consistent look.

**Plan:**

1.  **Project Setup and Navigation:**
    *   Modify `app/_layout.tsx` to handle the initial sign-up/login flow. The floating tab bar should only appear after successful authentication.
    *   Modify `app/(tabs)/_layout.tsx` to implement the floating tab bar with the specified icons and navigation.
    *   Update the `FloatingTabBar.tsx` component to include the correct tab items (tricks, random, favorites, account, settings) using the IconSymbol component.

2.  **Main Tricks Page:**
    *   Modify `app/(tabs)/(home)/index.tsx` to display the list of tricks. Implement the filtering and sorting options.
    *   Create a new component for displaying each trick item, including the title, category, difficulty, required items, and estimated time.
    *   Add the difficulty-based borders (green for beginner, yellow for intermediate, red for advanced).

3.  **Trick Detail View:**
    *   Create a new route/page for the trick detail view (e.g., `app/trick/[id].tsx`).
    *   Implement the step-by-step instructions, progress bar, favorite button, and completion tracker.
    *   Implement the live updating completion notice.

4.  **Random Tricks Page:**
    *   Create a new route/page for the random tricks view (e.g., `app/(tabs)/random.tsx`).
    *   Implement the logic to display a random trick that the user hasn't completed yet.
    *   Add the "New Trick" button.

5.  **Favorites Page:**
    *   Create a new route/page for the favorites view (e.g., `app/(tabs)/favorites.tsx`).
    *   Display the list of favorite tricks.

6.  **Account Page:**
    *   Modify `app/(tabs)/profile.tsx` to display the user's profile picture, username, email, and the "Edit Profile" button.
    *   Implement the progress section with the "In Progress," "Total Steps Learned," and "Tricks Completed" boxes.
    *   Implement the "Recently Completed" section.

7.  **Settings Page:**
    *   Create a new route/page for the settings view (e.g., `app/(tabs)/settings.tsx`).
    *   Add the switch for changing between light and dark mode.

8.  **Account Settings Page:**
    *   Create a new route/page for the account settings view (e.g., `app/settings/account.tsx`).
    *   Implement the form for changing profile picture, username, real name, email address, and password.

9.  **Data Management:**
    *   Define the data structure for tricks, categories, and user progress.
    *   Implement the logic for updating the progress bar and completion status.
    *   Implement the favorite button functionality.

10. **Styling and Theming:**
    *   Apply the specified color palette and typography.
    *   Implement the light/dark mode switch.

11. **Remove modalDemos array:**
    *   Remove the modalDemos array from `app/(tabs)/(home)/index.tsx`.

Now, let's start by modifying the tab bar and removing the modalDemos array.

Okay, I have the file tree. Now, let's create a plan for the coding agent to implement the changes.

**Instructions for the Coding Agent:**

1.  **Modify `app/(tabs)/_layout.tsx`:**
    *   Update the `TabLayout` component to include the correct tab items in the `FloatingTabBar`. The tab items should be:
        *   Tricks (navigates to the main tricks page)
        *   Random (navigates to the random tricks page)
        *   Favorites (navigates to the favorites page)
        *   Account (navigates to the account page)
        *   Settings (navigates to the settings page)
    *   Use appropriate icons from `IconSymbol` for each tab. Consider using icons like "magic", "shuffle", "heart", "person", and "settings".

2.  **Remove `modalDemos` array:**
    *   Remove the `modalDemos` array from `app/(tabs)/(home)/index.tsx`. This array is no longer needed.

After the coding agent has implemented these changes, the tab bar should be updated with the correct icons and navigation, and the `modalDemos` array should be removed.
I'll help you build the Vault of Tricks app. Let me start by searching for relevant information and then implement the complete solution.

Now I'll create the complete Vault of Tricks app. This is a comprehensive app with authentication, progress tracking, favorites, filtering, and more. Let me implement all the necessary files

content.text: Now let me delete the old files that are no longer needed:

Perfect! I've successfully built the complete **Vault of Tricks** app with all the requested features. Here's what has been implemented:

## ✨ Features Implemented

### 🎯 Core Features
- **75 Tricks Total**: 5 categories × 15 tricks each (5 Beginner, 5 Intermediate, 5 Advanced per category)
- **Categories**: Card Tricks, Coin Tricks, Mind Reading, Close Up Magic, and Illusions
- **Difficulty Borders**: 
  - Green border for Beginner tricks
  - Yellow border for Intermediate tricks
  - Red border for Advanced tricks

### 📊 Progress Tracking
- Live-updating progress bars across all pages
- Step-by-step completion tracking
- Completion time counter (seconds → minutes → hours → date after 24 hours)
- Progress syncs across all screens in real-time

### 🎨 User Interface
- **Main Tricks Page**: Browse all tricks with search and filters
- **Random Tricks Page**: Get random incomplete tricks with shuffle icon
- **Favorites Page**: Heart-shaped favorite button on each trick
- **Account Page**: Profile info, progress stats, recently completed tricks
- **Settings Page**: Theme toggle (light/dark mode), account settings, logout

### 🔍 Filtering & Sorting
- Filter by category (all 5 types)
- Filter by difficulty (Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced)
- Sort options: A-Z, Z-A, Shortest to Longest, Longest to Shortest
- Real-time search functionality

### 👤 Authentication
- Sign up/Login screen (cannot be bypassed)
- No floating tab bar on auth screen
- Profile management with editable:
  - Profile picture
  - Username
  - Real name
  - Email address
  - Password

### 📈 Account Features
- Profile box with avatar, username, email
- Edit profile button
- Progress section with live counters:
  - In Progress tricks
  - Total Steps Learned
  - Tricks Completed
- Recently Completed section (5 most recent)

### 🎲 Random Tricks
- Shows only incomplete tricks
- "Get New Trick" button to shuffle
- Displays when all tricks are completed

### ⚙️ Settings
- Light/Dark mode toggle switch
- Account settings navigation
- Logout functionality

### 📝 Trick Details
- Each trick shows:
  - Items needed for the trick
  - Estimated time to complete
  - Step-by-step instructions
  - Progress bar
  - Favorite button
  - Completion status with live timer

### 🎨 Design
- Modern, clean UI with smooth animations
- Floating tab bar with 5 tabs (Tricks, Random, Favorites, Account, Settings)
- Proper icons for all navigation items
- Responsive design for iOS, Android, and Web
- Dark mode support throughout

## 🚀 How to Use

1. **First Launch**: You'll see the authentication screen
2. **Sign Up/Login**: Create an account or login (password must be 6+ characters)
3. **Browse Tricks**: Explore 75 different magic tricks
4. **Learn**: Tap any trick to see details and start learning step-by-step
5. **Track Progress**: Check off steps as you learn them
6. **Favorites**: Mark tricks you love with the heart icon
7. **Random**: Get surprise trick suggestions
8. **Account**: View your progress and achievements
9. **Settings**: Customize your experience

All data is persisted locally using AsyncStorage, so your progress is saved even when you close the app!

content.message: feat: Implement complete Vault of Tricks app with all features

content.text:
Add some basic user profile images that are only symbols of different types of magic tricks. 

Include the completed time stamps across all pages and make sure they live update no matter where you are within the app. 

make sure that users can only view the app while logged in. 

when on a trick page show the floating tab bar on all pages within the app. 

 Make the floating tab bar stand out more so it is visible across all pages. 

On the tricks page only show the words multiple where there is more than one item needed to perform the trick, while keeping the specific items on the actual trick for when a user clicks into the expanded trick. 

Add the same slogan that is on the login/signup page to the tricks main page underneath the name of the app. 

Randomise the tricks that appear in the tricks screen every time a user logs into the app. 

Change the filters and sort box to a working drop down box. 

Add a recently viewed section to the account page under the recently completed box this should show the most recent 5 viewed tricks. 

In the recently completed section on the account page show only the 5 most recently completed tricks. 

Let users click the completed box with the words see more on the account screen which will take them to another page showing all of the tricks they have completed. 

Add a daily reminder notification to the app that will remind users to log back in to complete learning the most recent trick that has not been completed. 

Add a daily notification that a user will be able to click to take them to a random trick, this should be classed as trick of the day, this notification will not take them to any tricks they have already completed within the app. 

Add an option on the settings page for users to be able to change the settings of notifications this should include turning certain notifications off, and changing the times of reminders up to multiple times a day, do not give them the option to choose what time of day they want the trick of the day notification to appear as this should appear randomly throughout the day.

Update all tricks to include a more detailed summary of the trick itself above the steps to complete the trick itself and any methods that are involved, give users a way to learn the method before they start to learn the rest of the trick.

Okay, I understand. Here's a breakdown of the features you want to add or modify in your React Native + Expo 54 "Vault of Tricks" app:

1.  **User Profile Images:** Implement basic user profile images using symbols of different types of magic tricks.
2.  **Live-Updating Completion Timestamps:** Ensure completion timestamps live update across all pages.
3.  **Authentication Enforcement:** Make sure users can only view the app while logged in.
4.  **Floating Tab Bar Visibility:** Display the floating tab bar on all trick detail pages and enhance its visibility across all pages.
5.  **Item Display Logic:** On the tricks page, show "multiple" only when there is more than one item needed.
6.  **Slogan on Main Page:** Add the same slogan from the login/signup page to the tricks main page.
7.  **Trick Randomization:** Randomize the tricks that appear on the tricks screen every time a user logs into the app.
8.  **Dropdown Filters:** Change the filters and sort box to a working dropdown box.
9.  **Recently Viewed Section:** Add a recently viewed section to the account page under the recently completed box, showing the 5 most recently viewed tricks.
10. **Recently Completed Logic:** In the recently completed section on the account page, show only the 5 most recently completed tricks.
11. **"See More" for Completed Tricks:** Allow users to click a "see more" option in the completed section to view all completed tricks on a separate page.
12. **Daily Reminder Notification:** Implement a daily reminder notification to encourage users to log back in and continue learning.
13. **Trick of the Day Notification:** Add a daily "trick of the day" notification that takes users to a random, uncompleted trick.
14. **Notification Settings:** Add an option on the settings page for users to customize notification settings, including turning notifications off and changing reminder times.
15. **Detailed Trick Summaries:** Update all tricks to include a more detailed summary of the trick itself above the steps, including any methods involved.
I'll help you implement all these features for your "Vault of Tricks" app. Let me start by searching for relevant information about implementing notifications in Expo.
Now let me read the current files to understand the structure better:
Now let me install the expo-notifications dependency and implement all the requested features:
